title: Namsan Tower
desc: Enjoy panoramic views of Seoul and a romantic atmosphere from the iconic Namsan Tower.
tips: Visit at sunset to capture both daytime cityscapes and dazzling night views. Consider taking the cable car for an enhanced experience.
highlights: 360-degree observation deck, Love Locks, Namsan Park, N Seoul Tower Media Art

title: Gyeongbokgung Palace
desc: Immerse yourself in Korea's majestic history and traditional architecture at Gyeongbokgung Palace.
tips: Plan your visit to witness the impressive Royal Guard Changing Ceremony at Gwanghwamun Gate.
highlights: Grand traditional architecture, Royal Guard Changing Ceremony, National Folk Museum, Beautiful palace gardens

title: Han River
desc: Find relaxation and scenic beauty along the Han River, perfect for various outdoor activities.
tips: Enjoy a leisurely picnic, rent a bicycle, or experience a scenic river cruise, especially during sunset.
highlights: Yeouido Hangang park, Cycling paths, Han River cruises

title: Itaewon
desc: Discover a vibrant multicultural district known for its diverse international cuisine, trendy shops, and dynamic nightlife.
tips: Explore hidden alleys for unique cafes and boutiques. Best enjoyed in the evening for its bustling atmosphere.
highlights: Global restaurants and bars, Unique fashion, Lively nightlife, Diverse cultural experiences

title: Hongdae
desc: Dive into Seoul's youthful energy and artistic spirit in Hongdae, famous for its street performances and indie art scene.
tips: Weekends are buzzing with live music, street dances, and creative markets. Explore quirky shops and art galleries.
highlights: Street performances, Indie music venues, Artistic cafes, Trendy fashion boutiques, Mural Street

title: Naksan Park
desc: Enjoy magnificent views of Seoul and stroll along the historic Seoul City Wall at Naksan Park.
tips: An ideal spot for a leisurely walk, offering stunning city views, especially at night. Don't miss the charming Ihwa Mural Village nearby.
highlights: Seoul City Wall trail, Panoramic city views, Ihwa Mural Village, Artistic installations

title: Lotte World
desc: Experience a world of adventure and entertainment at Lotte World, featuring both indoor and outdoor attractions.
tips: Perfect for families with children, offering thrilling rides, parades, and a unique Magic Island concept.
highlights: Indoor and outdoor theme parks (Lotte World Adventure & Magic Island), Lotte World Aquarium, Ice Rink, Shopping mall

title: Gwangjang Market
desc: Savor authentic Korean street food and soak in the lively atmosphere of one of Korea's oldest traditional markets.
tips: You must try the famous Bindaetteok (mung bean pancake) and Mayak Gimbap (mini rice rolls) for a true taste of Seoul.
highlights: Delicious street food, Traditional textiles and crafts, Authentic market experience, Lively local vibe

title: Insadong
desc: Explore Insadong, a cultural street preserving traditional Korean charm with its antique shops, art galleries, and quaint tea houses.
tips: A great place to find unique Korean souvenirs and experience a traditional tea ceremony. Look out for the Ssamziegil complex.
highlights: Traditional crafts and art, Antique shops, Art galleries, Traditional teahouses, Ssamziegil shopping complex

title: Namdaemun Market
desc: Discover Seoul's largest traditional market, a bustling hub offering an immense variety of goods and local street food.
tips: Embrace the opportunity to bargain for prices. Don't forget to sample street snacks from the vendors.
highlights: Wide array of goods (clothing, household items, souvenirs), Authentic Korean street food, Vibrant local atmosphere, Traditional gate (Sungnyemun)

title: COEX Aquarium
desc: Dive into the fascinating underwater world at COEX Aquarium, a major attraction within the COEX complex.
tips: Located inside COEX Mall, making it easy to combine with shopping and dining. Great for educational and family fun.
highlights: Diverse marine life exhibits, Interactive displays, Thematic zones (e.g., Deep Blue Sea, Ocean Kingdom), Located within COEX Mall

title: Bukchon Hanok Village
desc: Wander through the beautifully preserved traditional Korean houses and charming alleys of Bukchon Hanok Village.
tips: Respect the residents' privacy as you explore this living village. Wear comfortable shoes for walking up hilly streets.
highlights: Traditional Hanok architecture, Picturesque alleyways, Cultural experience centers, Panoramic views of Seoul's skyline

title: Gangnam
desc: Experience Seoul's modern pulse in Gangnam, a district synonymous with luxury, high-end shopping, and K-Pop culture.
tips: Explore the upscale Apgujeong and Cheongdam-dong areas for luxury shopping. Visit Sinsa-dong Garosu-gil for trendy cafes and boutiques.
highlights: Luxury shopping (Cheongdam-dong), K-Star Road, Trendy cafes and boutiques (Garosu-gil), COEX Mall, Modern architecture

title: Seoul Sky
desc: Ascend to the top of Lotte World Tower and witness breathtaking 360-degree views of Seoul from Korea's highest observation deck.
tips: Visit on a clear day for the best visibility. Purchase tickets in advance to save time and ensure entry.
highlights: Korea's highest observation deck (123F), Glass-floored 'Sky Deck', Immersive media displays, Panoramic city views

title: Seoul Forest
desc: Enjoy a tranquil green oasis in the heart of Seoul, perfect for leisurely walks and nature encounters.
tips: Explore its various themed gardens, including the Deer Park and Insect Garden. Great for picnics and cycling.
highlights: Vast green spaces, Deer Park, Mirror Pond, Cultural Art Park, Ecological Forest, Walking and cycling paths
